Dodgeball is a game in which players on two teams try to throw balls at each other while avoiding being hit themselves. In North America, the game is typically played among children 6–12 in elementary school. However, internationally, the sport has also emerged as a popular middle school, high school and college sport. It is also popular in informal settings and is often played on a playground, sidewalk, street, or gym floor. The number of players on each team depends on the rules agreed upon, but usually consists of six to ten players on each team.
